summary: This is a discovery letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to defense counsel, providing an inventory of materials produced in the case against Jeffrey Epstein (19 Cr. 830). It details surveillance footage, prison records, and other evidence related to Epstein's incarceration and death at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), and includes Brady disclosures regarding inmate statements about guard rounds on the night of his death.

persons.name: Jason E. Foy
persons.context: Addressee of the discovery letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office, representing a defendant in the case.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The deceased defendant in the criminal case (19 Cr. 830). The document details the production of evidence related to his incarceration, cell, health records, and death at the MCC.

connections.description: Foy is the defense attorney receiving discovery materials on behalf of his client, Jeffrey Epstein, as indicated by the letter's address and context.

events.title: July 23 Incident at MCC
events.description: An incident at the Metropolitan Correctional Center involving Jeffrey Epstein, referenced by reports being produced as discovery.

events.title: Night Before Epstein's Death
events.description: The night before Jeffrey Epstein's death, referenced in Brady disclosures where inmates (Inmate-4, Inmate-5, Inmate-7, Inmate-11) gave statements about corrections officer rounds and counts.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein's Death
events.description: The date Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center. The document references the seizure of video surveillance footage and production of death reports and photos.

events.title: Protective Order Entered
events.description: A protective order was entered in the case, governing the handling of the discovery materials detailed in this letter.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office produced extensive discovery related to Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration and death, including MCC surveillance footage (7/5/2019-8/12/2019), death reports, cell photos, health records, and inmate commissary records.

Brady material disclosures include statements from four inmates (Inmate-4, Inmate-5, Inmate-7, Inmate-11) describing irregular or incomplete rounds by corrections officers on the night of August 9, 2019, into the morning of August 10, 2019.
Materials from a fifth inmate (Inmate-2) containing a potential Brady statement were withheld by court order due to pending ex parte litigation.

The Government also produced financial records from multiple banks (JPMorgan Chase, Bank of America, Citibank, etc.) for individuals whose names are redacted, provided only to a specific defendant's counsel.
The letter confirms certain surveillance cameras at the MCC were not functioning, had not been processed, or were not available during the period in question.
